code: export const artPieces={gioconda:{title:"Pumpkin soup on Leonardo da Vinci's La Gioconda",location:"Louvre Museum, Paris – January 28, 2024",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Pumpkin soup on oil on poplar panel, hurled with a decisive gesture against Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa. The liquid strikes and slides toward the lower frame, tracing an orange veil. A performance executed by two members of Riposte Alimentaire and witnessed by dozens. The act reframes the painting as a silent witness to an agricultural system in crisis.",mainImage:"/assets/img/gioconda-capitalism.jpg",previewImage:"https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",previewText:"Weapon: Tomato Soup"},lesmeules:{title:"Mashed potatoes on Monet's Les Meules",location:"Musée d'Orsay, Paris – October 23, 2022",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Mashed potatoes on oil on canvas, thrown with precision against Claude Monet's iconic Les Meules. The starchy substance creates a dramatic contrast against the impressionist masterpiece, symbolizing the clash between industrial agriculture and artistic beauty.",mainImage:"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/4/4e/Claude_Monet_-_Meules_%28W_1273%29.jpg",previewImage:"/assets/img/pure-patata.png",previewText:"Weapon: Mashed Potatoes"},deathandlife:{title:"Fossil fuels on Klimt's Death and Life",location:"Leopold Museum, Vienna – November 15, 2022",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Fossil fuels on oil on canvas, symbolically applied to Gustav Klimt's Death and Life. The dark substance represents the environmental cost of our energy consumption, creating a powerful metaphor for the death of our planet through human activity.",mainImage:"/assets/img/deathandlife-capitalism.jpg",previewImage:"https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",previewText:"Weapon: Fossil Fuels"},thesower:{title:"Pea soup on Van Gogh's The Sower",location:"Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam – September 8, 2022",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Pea soup on oil on canvas, thrown against Vincent van Gogh's The Sower. The green liquid represents the agricultural revolution and the transformation of farming from artisanal to industrial, questioning the sustainability of our food systems.",mainImage:"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/af/Vincent_van_Gogh_-_The_Sower_-_c._17-28_June_1888.jpg",previewImage:"https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",previewText:"Weapon: Pea Soup"},sunflowers:{title:"Tomato soup on Van Gogh's Sunflowers",location:"National Gallery, London – July 12, 2022",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Tomato soup on oil on canvas, applied to Van Gogh's iconic Sunflowers. The red liquid creates a striking contrast against the yellow flowers, symbolizing the blood of exploited workers in the agricultural industry.",mainImage:"/assets/img/sunflowers-capitalism.jpg",previewImage:"https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",previewText:"Weapon: Tomato Soup"},giverny:{title:"Red paint on Claude Monet's The Artist's Garden at Giverny",location:"Musée d'Orsay, Paris – May 30, 2023",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Red paint on oil on canvas, symbolically applied to Monet's garden masterpiece. The red liquid against the spring colors represents the violence of industrial agriculture against the natural world.",mainImage:"https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c3/Monet_-_Le_Printemps%2C_1886.jpg",previewImage:"https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",previewText:"Weapon: Tomato Soup"},campbells:{title:"Blue marks and instant adhesive on Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans",location:"Museum of Modern Art, New York – December 3, 2022",concept:"Capitalism",description:"Blue marks and instant adhesive on silkscreen ink on canvas, applied to Warhol's iconic Campbell's Soup Cans. The intervention critiques consumer culture and the commodification of art, turning Warhol's own commentary back on itself.",mainImage:"https://subastareal.es/uploads/subastareal.es/attachments/60681/andy-warhol-consomme-campbells-soup-2130.jpg",previewImage:"https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",previewText:"Weapon: Blue Paint & Glue"}};

sourcesContent:
export const artPieces = {
  gioconda: {
    title: "Pumpkin soup on Leonardo da Vinci's La Gioconda",
    location: "Louvre Museum, Paris – January 28, 2024",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Pumpkin soup on oil on poplar panel, hurled with a decisive gesture against Leonardo da Vinci's Mona Lisa. The liquid strikes and slides toward the lower frame, tracing an orange veil. A performance executed by two members of Riposte Alimentaire and witnessed by dozens. The act reframes the painting as a silent witness to an agricultural system in crisis.",
    mainImage: "/assets/img/gioconda-capitalism.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Tomato Soup"
  },
  lesmeules: {
    title: "Mashed potatoes on Monet's Les Meules",
    location: "Musée d'Orsay, Paris – October 23, 2022",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Mashed potatoes on oil on canvas, thrown with precision against Claude Monet's iconic Les Meules. The starchy substance creates a dramatic contrast against the impressionist masterpiece, symbolizing the clash between industrial agriculture and artistic beauty.",
    mainImage: "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/4/4e/Claude_Monet_-_Meules_%28W_1273%29.jpg",
    previewImage: "/assets/img/pure-patata.png",
    previewText: "Weapon: Mashed Potatoes"
  },
  deathandlife: {
    title: "Fossil fuels on Klimt's Death and Life",
    location: "Leopold Museum, Vienna – November 15, 2022",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Fossil fuels on oil on canvas, symbolically applied to Gustav Klimt's Death and Life. The dark substance represents the environmental cost of our energy consumption, creating a powerful metaphor for the death of our planet through human activity.",
    mainImage: "/assets/img/deathandlife-capitalism.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Fossil Fuels"
  },
  thesower: {
    title: "Pea soup on Van Gogh's The Sower",
    location: "Van Gogh Museum, Amsterdam – September 8, 2022",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Pea soup on oil on canvas, thrown against Vincent van Gogh's The Sower. The green liquid represents the agricultural revolution and the transformation of farming from artisanal to industrial, questioning the sustainability of our food systems.",
    mainImage: "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/a/af/Vincent_van_Gogh_-_The_Sower_-_c._17-28_June_1888.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Pea Soup"
  },
  sunflowers: {
    title: "Tomato soup on Van Gogh's Sunflowers",
    location: "National Gallery, London – July 12, 2022",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Tomato soup on oil on canvas, applied to Van Gogh's iconic Sunflowers. The red liquid creates a striking contrast against the yellow flowers, symbolizing the blood of exploited workers in the agricultural industry.",
    mainImage: "/assets/img/sunflowers-capitalism.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Tomato Soup"
  },
  giverny: {
    title: "Red paint on Claude Monet's The Artist's Garden at Giverny",
    location: "Musée d'Orsay, Paris – May 30, 2023",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Red paint on oil on canvas, symbolically applied to Monet's garden masterpiece. The red represents the blood spilled in the name of progress and the environmental destruction caused by unchecked capitalism.",
    mainImage: "https://www.meisterdrucke.us/kunstwerke/1260px/Claude_Monet_-_The_Artists_Garden_in_Giverny_-_%28MeisterDrucke-1326270%29.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Red Paint"
  },
  leprintemps: {
    title: "Tomato soup on Claude Monet's Le Printemps",
    location: "Musée d'Orsay, Paris – March 21, 2024",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Tomato soup on oil on canvas, applied to Monet's spring landscape. The red liquid against the spring colors represents the violence of industrial agriculture against the natural world.",
    mainImage: "https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/c3/Monet_-_Le_Printemps%2C_1886.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Tomato Soup"
  },
  campbells: {
    title: "Blue marks and instant adhesive on Andy Warhol's Campbell's Soup Cans",
    location: "Museum of Modern Art, New York – December 3, 2022",
    concept: "Capitalism",
    description: "Blue marks and instant adhesive on silkscreen ink on canvas, applied to Warhol's iconic Campbell's Soup Cans. The intervention critiques consumer culture and the commodification of art, turning Warhol's own commentary back on itself.",
    mainImage: "https://subastareal.es/uploads/subastareal.es/attachments/60681/andy-warhol-consomme-campbells-soup-2130.jpg",
    previewImage: "https://tienda.upper.es/documents/10180/561690/71601_G.jpg",
    previewText: "Weapon: Blue Paint & Glue"
  }
};
